intro: Tryphane verna, commonly known as the spring tryphane, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is native to temperate regions of Europe and parts of Asia. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters and produces small, white or pale yellow flowers in umbels. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, often used in traditional herbal medicine. Tryphane verna thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges.
